rivers.name: Amazon River
rivers.fact: The Amazon River is the largest river by water volume in the world and is home to diverse ecosystems.

rivers.name: Nile River
rivers.fact: The Nile is often considered the longest river in the world and was crucial to the development of ancient Egyptian civilization.

rivers.name: Yangtze River
rivers.fact: The Yangtze River is the longest river in Asia and is home to several endangered species, including the Chinese alligator.

rivers.name: Mississippi River
rivers.fact: The Mississippi River is the second-longest river in North America and has played a significant role in American history and commerce.

rivers.name: Yenisei River
rivers.fact: The Yenisei River is the largest river system flowing to the Arctic Ocean and is an important transportation route in Siberia.

rivers.name: Congo River
rivers.fact: The Congo River is the second-longest river in Africa and is known for its deep waters and powerful rapids.

rivers.name: Mekong River
rivers.fact: The Mekong River flows through six countries and is crucial for agriculture and fisheries in the region.

items.name: Skittle
items.fact: Skittles were first produced in the 1970s in the United Kingdom and have a distinctive fruity flavor.

items.name: Hot Dog
items.fact: Hot dogs, also known as frankfurters, are named after Frankfurt, Germany, where they originated.

items.name: Foot-Long Hot Dog
items.fact: The foot-long hot dog is a popular American food item, often served at sporting events and barbecues.

items.name: Matchbox Car
items.fact: Matchbox cars were first introduced in 1953 and are known for their detailed miniature models of real vehicles.

items.name: Statue of Liberty
items.fact: The Statue of Liberty was a gift from France to the United States and was dedicated on October 28, 1886.

items.name: Deepest Part of the Ocean (Mariana Trench)
items.fact: The Mariana Trench is the deepest part of the world's oceans and reaches a depth of about 11,000 meters.

items.name: 50-Inch TV (Length of Widescreen TV)
items.fact: A 50-inch TV has become a standard size for large home entertainment screens, offering a cinematic experience.

items.name: Marathon
items.fact: A marathon is a long-distance running event with a standard length of 42.195 kilometers, originating from the ancient Greek marathon run.

items.name: Ham
items.fact: Ham is a type of processed meat that comes from the hind leg of a pig and has been a staple in many cultures for centuries.

items.name: Shortest Mountain (Mount Wycheproof)
items.fact: Mount Wycheproof in Australia is considered the world's shortest mountain, with a length of just 148 meters.

items.name: Dr. Pepper Can
items.fact: A standard Dr. Pepper can holds 355 milliliters of soda and is known for its unique blend of 23 flavors.
